thread.title: Cristiano Ronaldo urges Real Madrid to sign Portugal star? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers
thread.title_full: Cristiano Ronaldo urges Real Madrid to sign Portugal star? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers

author: Football Spy
title: Cristiano Ronaldo urges Real Madrid to sign Portugal star? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers
text:
Sport Cristiano Ronaldo urges Real Madrid to sign Portugal star? Transfer news and gossip from Wednesday's papers PLUS: Potential Barcelona target and current Athgletic Bilbao manager Ernesto Valverde will make a decision on his future this week Share Get Real Madrid CF updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Cristiano Ronaldo has reportedly urged Real Madrid to sign his international team-mate Andre Silva. 
Silva has shone for Porto this season and already has 15 league goals. Portuguese paper A Bola say Ronaldo has put in a good word with Bernabeu's hierachy. 
At just 21-years-old, Silva still has a lot of developing to do but could be the perfect antidote to Real's ageing forward line. 
But what other transfer stories are there in Wednesday's paper? Here's our round-up of the latest news and gossip... Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Antonio Conte gives major update on John Terry's future at Chelsea Share this video Watch Next Top stories from the Daily Mirror 
Chelsea believe they can land Romelu Lukaku this summer, with the in-form striker warning he won't agree a contract extension at Everton. Optimism has been high at Goodison that the 23-year-old Belgian would commit himself to a lucrative new five-year contract worth £140,000-a-week, keeping him from the champions-elect's clutches. But despite his agent Mino Raiola claiming in December and again last month to be “99.9999 per cent" sure he'd sign, Lukaku is now understood to be unwilling to do so — unless a release clause of no more than £70million is included. 
Marseille teenager Maxime Lopez says Liverpool approached him last year, telling him he could be Philippe Coutinho's successor. 
Aitor Karanka faces a make-or-break clash with Manchester United at the Riverside on Sunday. The Middlesbrough boss is fighting for his future after his side plunged deep into relegation trouble, and his tenure is likely to come under review during next week’s international break if his side flops again. Lukaku could be on his way to Chelsea (Photo: PA Wire) 
Gareth Southgate is considering a shock England recall for Andy Carroll. And the 28-year-old West Ham striker could be joined in the Three Lions squad for this month's double header against Germany and Lithuania by fellow Hammers forward Michail Antonio. The pair are in the frame because Southgate has been hit by a rash of injuries up front, with Harry Kane, skipper Wayne Rooney and Daniel Sturridge all out. He could also call up 34-year-old Jermain Defoe. 
Slaven Bilic's future will be decided at the end of the season. Despite claims last week that a new deal was close for the popular West Ham boss, club chiefs will look at his performance in one of the annual reviews that follow every campaign. 
Jose Mourinho and his Manchester United players were left raging at their club’s shambolic organisation at Heathrow Airport on Monday night. A jet chartered by United officials to fly the team and technical staff back to Manchester straight after their controversial FA Cup loss to Chelsea was still overseas upon their arrival at Heathrow. The squad nded up making a four-hour bus journey and didn't get back to Manchester until 4am — far from ideal when they face Rostov in the second leg of a Europa League last-16 tie on Thursday. Transfer news from other newspapers and websites Yannick Carrasco (L) competes for the ball with Florian Lejeune (Photo: Getty) 
Arsenal are reportedly expected to seal a deal for Eibar defender Florian Lejeune this summer. (Marca) 
Potential Barcelona target and current Athletic Bilbao manager Ernesto Valverde will make a decision on his future this week. (Sport) 
Newcastle are considering a move for St Etienne defender Mickael Nade and Nice's Wylan Cyprien . (Newcastle Chronicle) Like us on Facebook
